benchmark_details.name: Hummer
benchmark_details.overview: Hummer is a novel pairwise preference dataset designed to reduce conflicts among alignment objectives, enhancing reinforcement learning from human feedback by minimizing competing dynamics in preference datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that reduces conflicts among alignment objectives to improve downstream applications in language models.

data.source: Hummer is constructed based on the UltraFeedback dataset, utilizing AI feedback mechanisms such as GPT-4 for annotation and refinement.
data.annotation: Annotated through human feedback using AI systems.

methodology.calculation: The ADC is calculated as the second-order moment of negative performance deviation on all evaluation dimensions in the benchmark, focusing on performance reductions across different alignment objectives.
methodology.interpretation: A lower ADC value indicates reduced conflict among alignment objectives, which is desirable for effective preference modeling.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared with existing preference datasets like Anthropic HH and UltraFeedback, Hummer shows improved performance and reduced ADC.
methodology.validation: Validated through performance comparison on standard evaluation metrics across different datasets.

harm: Reducing vulnerabilities to jailbreak attacks by balancing performance across objectives.
